answers.answer: My sister had it...she gave birth 2 months early...her baby's were only 2 pounds they were in the nicu for a month but now they are both healthy and just fine. :)

My sister found out she had it due to excess swelling. She went into the local hospital and they sent her to a big city nearby to Parkview. She went in on Sunday and delivered her son at 26 weeks Wednesday. He lived 10 whole days. He was in the NICU and he just wasn't strong enough. It was so hard for our family. Preeclampsia is scary and you just need to watch for your symptoms if they worsen. My sister was at the point where if he didn't come out it was either she died or the baby did. She was shaving severe liver pain and all of her organs started to shut down. Preeclampsia is nothing to not be worried about. It's something that needs to be monitored and watched. Protein in urine, high blood pressure, headaches and blurred vision. Praying for you and your little one! Not all preeclamptic mommies have the same outcome. So I pray your little one makes it full term before you have to give birth! The older your baby is, the better chances it has.

Oh :( I'm so sorry for your family and sisters loss. That's just very sad. I just prey that doesn't happen to me, and they catch it earlier.I hope catching it early helps,I take aspirin to thin my blood and I go for my check up next week so I prey my little on will go full term. I'm so worried but I'm trying so hard not to be as it will make my blood pressure go up even more.Thank you ladies xx

I am just glad they caught it. Just scary because it is unpredictable. They tried to prolong my sister's as much as they could. Then get liver enzymes started To go crazy. I am happy you're being monitored though!! :)

question: I posted the other day about my high blood pressure.Thank you ladies for your advice and comments.I got a call from the hospital to tell me my blood work come back in and they linked my ultrasound up and bub is perfect.Though next Thursday I will be 13 weeks and 4 days and they want me to come in every 1-2 weeks for preeclampsia. Has anyone had this through pregnancy? And will my baby be okay :(
title: Preeclampsia..
